Field Note: If no middle initial, please put a hyphen (-) as a place holder

Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Hispanic or Latino | 1, NOT Hispanic or Latino | 2, Unknown / Not Reported
0, American Indian/Alaska Native | 1, Asian | 2, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander | 3, Black or African American | 4, White | 5, More Than One Race | 6, Unknown / Not Reported

Field Note: Indicate if the subject experienced any adverse events.

Field Label: What is the adverse event term?
Field Note: Record only one diagnosis, sign or symptom per form (e.g., nausea and vomiting should not be recorded in the same entry, but as two separate entries).  See eCRF completion instruction for more information.

Field Label: Does the subject have (specific adverse event)?
Field Note: Please indicate if (specific adverse event) has occurred /is occurring by checking Yes or No.

Field Label: What is the date the adverse event started?
Field Note: Record the start date of the adverse event using the MM-DD-YYYY format.

Field Label: Is the adverse event still ongoing?
What date did the adverse event end?
Field Note: Record the end date of the adverse event using the MM-DD-YYYY format.

Field Label: What was the severity of the adverse event?
Field Note: The reporting physician/healthcare professional will assess the severity of the event using the sponsor-defined categories. This assessment is subjective and the reporting physician/ healthcare professional should use medical judgment to compare the reported Adverse Event to similar type events observed in clinical practice. Severity is not equivalent to seriousness.

Field Label: Is this event related to study treatment?
Field Note: Indicate if the cause of the adverse event is related to the study treatment and cannot be reasonably explained by other factors (e.g., subject's clinical state, concomitant therapy, and/or other interventions).

Field Label: Did the adverse event cause the subject to be discontinued from the study?
Field Note: Record if the AE caused the subject to discontinue from the study.
